title: Add app share link (copy/share main URL)

requirements.text: Add a small frontend utility for building a shareable app link that points to the app’s main entry route using the current hash-based routing convention (e.g., `window.location.origin + '/#/'`). Reuse the existing clipboard helper behavior already used for invite links (`copyToClipboard` in `frontend/src/utils/inviteLinks.ts`).

quotes: Add a way to share the app

acceptanceCriteria: A utility function exists that returns a string URL for sharing the app home (uses `window.location.origin` and `/#/`).
Copy-to-clipboard uses the existing `copyToClipboard` fallback implementation (no new clipboard implementation introduced).

requirements.text: Add a user-facing UI action to share the app itself by copying the app link to the clipboard. Place this action in an always-available location in the authenticated app shell (e.g., in the top navigation in `frontend/src/components/layout/AppNav.tsx`). Use English user-facing text and the existing toast pattern (`sonner`) to confirm success/failure (e.g., success: “App link copied”, failure: “Failed to copy link”).

quotes: Add a way to share the app

acceptanceCriteria: Authenticated users can trigger a “Share” action from the app navigation/shell UI.
Triggering the action copies the app share URL to the clipboard.
A success toast is shown on successful copy and an error toast is shown if copy fails.
All user-facing text for this feature is in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or anything inside `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing components instead).
Keep routing consistent with the app’s current hash-based URL format (e.g., `/#/`).
No backend changes are required for sharing the app link.
nonGoals: Do not add third-party social sharing integrations (e.g., Twitter/Facebook APIs).
Do not add new authentication methods beyond Internet Identity.
Do not implement real-time share tracking/analytics.
